about.short: TRAC App tracks remote devices in real time and lets admins trigger safe actions like lock, restart, or scripted commands from a single dashboard.
about.long:
TRAC App tackles the visibility gap that appears once machines leave the office or classroom. A lightweight agent sends heartbeat, status, and optional activity hints, while the dashboard shows which devices are online, who is using them, and what actions are available.

Admins can drill into a machine, run safe remote actions, and review recent events without heavy enterprise tooling. The system stays modular so privacy-sensitive deployments can enable only the data and controls they need.

roles_and_responsibilities: Scoped a lightweight, scriptable tracking and control tool for distributed devices.
Designed information architecture and UX for the TRAC dashboard.
Implemented backend APIs and data models for devices, heartbeats, and actions.
Defined the desktop agent approach and alert/notification pipeline.
objectives: Provide a single view of all critical devices with online/offline clarity.
Offer safe, auditable remote actions without complex tooling.
Keep the architecture modular for future integrations and SaaS packaging.

device_and_activity_tracking: Device registration with IDs, hostnames, and tags.
Online/offline status with last-seen timestamps and basic metrics.
Optional activity hints such as active window titles or app lists.
Configurable privacy levels per device or policy.
remote_control_actions: Remote lock or sign out where OS supports it.
Custom admin-defined commands for quick fixes.
All actions logged with user and timestamp.
dashboard_and_ux: Global list with search and filters for status, tag, or location.
Device detail view with timeline of status and actions.
Color-coded health indicators and quick actions.
alerts_and_reporting: Configurable alerts for offline devices or high resource usage.
Summaries of uptime, incidents, and actions executed.
security_and_privacy_controls: Agent authentication via API keys or tokens.
Granular toggles for screenshots or app-level tracking.
admin_and_configuration: Group devices by department, project, or location.
Policy profiles to enable/disable features per group.
Export logs for compliance or troubleshooting.

backend: Python backend using FastAPI / Django REST Framework for APIs.
Workers/cron jobs for heartbeats and alerts.
Optional WebSockets or long-poll for real-time updates.
agent_side: Lightweight desktop agent running as a background service.
OS integrations for metrics and remote commands.
Config-based provisioning for registration and server URL.
frontend: Reusable components for device tables and activity timelines.
data_and_storage: PostgreSQL for devices, users, actions, and logs.
Redis for caching current device states.
integrations: Email provider or webhook endpoints for alerts.
hosting_devops: Containerized services (Docker) for backend, dashboard, and workers.
Deployed on VPS/cloud with environment-based configuration.
Health checks and log aggregation for the TRAC backend.

budget.notes: Equivalent commercial value covering design, backend, agent, dashboard, and alerting; primary cost is internal engineering and infra.

challenges: Balancing visibility with privacy and trust requirements.
Making remote actions safe and auditable for admins.
Keeping the agent lightweight but reliable for always-on use.
solutions: Made agent modules toggleable so deployments choose the data they collect.
Logged every action with confirmations for sensitive operations.
Kept the dashboard clean with filters and detail views for deeper dives.

qualitative: Clear real-time view of internal machines reduces guesswork.
Centralized responses like lock or restart without physical access.
Foundation for future automation and SaaS packaging within DewCo/Gloventis.
outcomes.example_metrics_note: Success is measured in reduced manual checks and faster responses; public metrics can be added after wider rollout.
